snippet: Many taxpayers wrongly claim personal car use as a business expense.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economics Prof James R Alm and accounting and information systems Prof Jay A Soled warns of problem of many taxpayers claiming their personal car use as business expense, thereby essentially getting taxpayer subsidies for their gasoline; urges Congress to implement reforms that will curb such abuse of tax code.

byline.original: By JAMES R. ALM and JAY A. SOLED

lead_paragraph: Many taxpayers wrongly claim personal car use as a business expense.

headline.seo: Filling the Gas Tank on Taxpayers’ Dime
